translation.en: I thank God for all the freedoms we've got in this country. - I cherish them. -
translation.ja: この国の自由は神のおかげ ありがたいことだ

translation.en: Even the rights to burn the flag, you know, I'm proud of those rights.
translation.ja: 国旗を燃やす権利だって 誇りに思う

translation.en: - - But I'll tell you what,
translation.ja: でもさらに―

translation.en: we've also got-- Let me tell you something. Shh.
translation.ja: 我々には… 知ってるとは思うけど

translation.en: We've also got a right to bear arms, and if you burn my flag, I'll shoot you.
translation.ja: 銃を持つ権利もある 国旗を燃やされたら撃つ

translation.en: But I'll shoot you with a lot of love, like a good American.
translation.ja: 良きアメリカ人として 愛情を込めて

translation.en: In the '60s and '70s, America was torn apart
translation.ja: 60～70年代の アメリカは分裂していた

translation.en: around issues of race, war, peace,
translation.ja: 人種 戦争 平和の 問題について

translation.en: and a battle for the heart and soul of what it meant to be an American patriot.
translation.ja: 愛国者としての心や魂は どうあるべきか

translation.en: We will determine what kind of nation America will be.
translation.ja: 我々がアメリカの 将来を決める

translation.en: It's the prettiest country in the world that we've got.
translation.ja: この国は世界で最も美しい

translation.en: - There ain't nothing like it anywhere. -
translation.ja: 他に類がない

translation.en: Mr. Nixon said Johnny Cash speaks to all America.
translation.ja: 彼は全国民に影響力 がある

translation.en: He understood Johnny Cash's symbolic importance.
translation.ja: 彼の象徴的価値に 目をつけた

translation.en: Country music is the Johnny Cash crowd.
translation.ja: カントリー好きを感化する

translation.en: - It gets you elected. - Yeah. You know, it's Southern.
translation.ja: 機密テープ 当選できるよ 南部で人気だから

translation.en: Nixon wanted to identify with Middle America,
translation.ja: ニクソンは中産階級に 共鳴したかった

translation.en: and Johnny Cash was as Middle America as you can get.
translation.ja: ジョニー以上の逸材は いなかった

translation.en: We got a phone call from the White House. It was President Nixon.
translation.ja: ニクソン大統領ご本人から 電話がありました

translation.en: He had invited Johnny to sing and do a concert there.
translation.ja: ジョニーに コンサートの 開催をお願いされた

translation.en: President Nixon requested that John sing
translation.ja: ニクソン大統領は 彼にカントリーの―

translation.en: redneck country music songs,
translation.ja: 演奏を依頼した

translation.en: affiliating country music with the president's cause,
translation.ja: カントリーと大統領の 動機を関係づけることは―

translation.en: and the result was just catastrophic.
translation.ja: 大失敗に終わった

translation.en: How could the president be so mean- spirited?
translation.ja: 大統領がそんなに汚い手 を使うなんて

translation.en: Johnny was very, very conflicted.
translation.ja: ジョニーは深く葛藤した

translation.en: It was a defining moment for him.
translation.ja: 彼にとって決定的瞬間だった

translation.en: Ladies and gentlemen, Johnny Cash!
translation.ja: ジョニー·キャッシュ！

translation.en: Thank you very much.
translation.ja: ありがとう

translation.en: Who was going to show up to the White House?
translation.ja: 誰がホワイトハウスまで―

translation.en: Johnny Cash of Folsom Prison Blues,
translation.ja: 不法監禁や反逆者の歌を―

translation.en: The Rebel...
translation.ja: 聞きに来る？

translation.en: So, what do you want to hear?
translation.ja: 何を聞きたい？

translation.en: ...the guy who was photographed flippin' off the man,
translation.ja: 権力に楯を突きながらも

translation.en: or the God- fearing family man with a baby on the way,
translation.ja: 神を恐れ 家族を愛し ゴスペルを歌う―

translation.en: gospel- singing Johnny Cash.
translation.ja: ジョニー·キャッシュだ

translation.en: How do you be both?
translation.ja: 両極端だった

translation.en: What did Johnny Cash stand for?
translation.ja: 彼は何を支持したのか

translation.en: Carl Perkins wrote a song that tells about the reason for it all.
translation.ja: カール·パーキンスが理由 全てを物語る曲を書いた

translation.en: It takes us back home and again,
translation.ja: 心が再び故郷に帰り

translation.en: tells it like it was when I was a little- bitty kid
translation.ja: 子供の頃聞いた話を思い出す

translation.en: and we gathered around the piano,
translation.ja: ピアノの周りに集まり

translation.en: and me and little brother would join in and Mama'd sing tenor and Daddy sang bass.
translation.ja: 僕と弟も加わって母がテナー  父がバスを歌った

translation.en: ♪ I remember when I was a lad Times were hard and things were bad... ♪
translation.ja: 俺が若い頃 世間は 　　不景気で最悪だった

translation.en: Johnny was born in Kingsland,
translation.ja: 妹 ジョアン·キャッシュ 彼はアーカンソー州の―

translation.en: in south Arkansas.
translation.ja: 南部で生まれました

translation.en: ♪ Just poor people That's all we were ♪
translation.ja: ただの貧乏人だった

translation.en: ♪ Trying to make a living Out of black land dirt ♪
translation.ja: 黒い土を元手に暮らした

translation.en: ♪ We'd get together In a family circle singing loud... ♪
translation.ja: 家族で輪になって 　　一緒に大声で歌った

translation.en: When my family came to Dyess, Johnny was three years old.
translation.ja: 家族でダイエスに 引越した時― 彼は３歳でした

translation.en: ♪ Singin' seems to help a troubled soul ♪
translation.ja: 歌は問題を抱えた者を救った

translation.en: ♪ One of these days and it won't be long ♪
translation.ja: そのうち俺も

translation.en: ♪ I'll rejoin them in a song ♪
translation.ja: 彼らと一緒に歌おう

translation.en: ♪ I'm gonna join the family circle At the Throne ♪
translation.ja: 成功の暁には 　　家族の輪に加わろう

translation.en: Now each one of these houses had a barn,
translation.ja: ジョニー·キャッシュが 子供時代を過ごした家 この辺にあった家には 必ず納屋と―

translation.en: a chicken house, and a smoke- house where the farmers raised their own hogs and cured their meat.
translation.ja: 鶏小屋と豚を育て肉を熟成 させるための小屋があって

translation.en: And they had a mule and 20 acres of land here.
translation.ja: ラバ１頭と20エーカーを 所有してた

translation.en: It was a beautiful little place.
translation.ja: 美しい場所だった

translation.en: The Dyess, Arkansas experience was part of FDR's New Deal.
translation.ja: ダイエスへの引越しは ＦＤＲの政策だった ダイエスへの引越しは ＦＤＲの政策だった 友人 マーク·スティルパー

translation.en: They moved people from terrible situations where they had no hope, no future,
translation.ja: 希望も将来もないどん底 から人々を救い―

translation.en: and gave them an opportunity.
translation.ja: チャンスを与えた

translation.en: ♪ My clothes may be ragged And my shoes may be worn ♪
translation.ja: 俺の服や靴は 　　ボロかもしれないが

translation.en: ♪ But I've been a wealthy boy Since I've been born... ♪
translation.ja: 俺は生まれつき裕福だった

translation.en: We were a happy family. We didn't know we were poor.
translation.ja: 幸せでした 貧乏とは思わなかった 幸せでした 貧乏とは思わなかった 弟　音楽家 トミー·キャッシュ

translation.en: We always had plenty to eat and plenty of clothes.
translation.ja: 弟　音楽家 トミー·キャッシュ 弟　音楽家 トミー·キャッシュ 食料も衣類も十分あった

translation.en: We were happy to be part of the American dream.
translation.ja: アメリカンドリームを 楽しく生きた

translation.en: Our family would start the day in the cotton fields,
translation.ja: 一日の仕事は歌いながら 綿畑から始まった

translation.en: singing old church hymns and songs that we all knew, we'd sing together.
translation.ja: 一日の仕事は歌いながら 綿畑から始まった 古い聖歌や皆が知って いる歌を一緒に歌った

translation.en: Gospel songs or country songs
translation.ja: ゴスペルやカントリーをね

translation.en: because it's about our life with the Lord.
translation.ja: 神と生きる人生の歌を

translation.en: Johnny's grandfather was a hellfire preacher.
translation.ja: 彼の祖父は激烈な牧師だった

translation.en: He had preacher grandparents on multiple lines of his family tree.
translation.ja: 家系を辿ると牧師だった 祖父母が複数存在した

translation.en: They spoke of hell and damnation,
translation.ja: 地獄や天罰についてや―

translation.en: and what it was like if you did not live the right kind of a life.
translation.ja: 正しく生きないと どうなるかを説いた

translation.en: John was a dyed- in- the- wool conservative person
translation.ja: 彼は非常に保守的な人だった 彼は非常に保守的な人だった ジミー·スノウ牧師

translation.en: because his parents were. He was from that part of Arkansas.
translation.ja: 両親もそう 出身地がそうさせた

translation.en: I don't remember anybody in our family criticizing the government.
translation.ja: 家族が政府を批判した記憶は 全くありません

translation.en: We were patriotic no matter who the president was.
translation.ja: 誰が大統領でも 愛国者だった

translation.en: We loved to see the American flag flown.
translation.ja: はためく星条旗を 見るのが大好きだった

translation.en: My daddy flew it every day until the day he died.
translation.ja: 父は亡くなる日まで 毎日飾った

translation.en: Johnny loved America.
translation.ja: ジョニーはアメリカが 大好きだった

translation.en: He believed that you should support your government
translation.ja: 彼は政府を支持すべきと 信じていた マネージャー ルー·ロビン

translation.en: and support the president.
translation.ja: 大統領も同様に

translation.en: He was one of the most patriotic men I've ever known.
translation.ja: 彼ほどの愛国者には 会ったことがない

translation.en: In 1968, the idea of patriotism itself
translation.ja: 1968年 愛国主義 そのものが― 1968年 愛国主義 そのものが― 反戦活動家 作家 ビル·ジマーマン 反戦活動家 作家 ビル·ジマーマン

translation.en: became controversial.
translation.ja: 反戦活動家 作家 ビル·ジマーマン 議論の的になった

translation.en: As we look at America, we see cities enveloped in smoke and flames.
translation.ja: アメリカの街が煙と炎に 包まれている

translation.en: We hear sirens in the night.
translation.ja: 夜はサイレンが響く

translation.en: We see Americans dying on distant battlefields abroad.
translation.ja: アメリカ人が遠くの 戦場で倒れ―

translation.en: We see Americans hating each other, fighting each other,
translation.ja: 国内でお互いを憎み合い 争い合い― 〝召集令状燃やす〞 国内でお互いを憎み合い 争い合い―

translation.en: killing each other at home.
translation.ja: 殺し合っている

translation.en: It was a period where
translation.ja: 当時 様々な問題が危機的 状況にあった 演説作成者 アラム·バクシャン

translation.en: lots of stuff came to a boil at the same time.
translation.ja: 当時 様々な問題が危機的 状況にあった 演説作成者 アラム·バクシャン 当時 様々な問題が危機的 状況にあった 当時 様々な問題が危機的 状況にあった 〝自由と正義は誰に？〞 〝自由と正義は誰に？〞

translation.en: We not only have a right to be free, we have a duty to be free.
translation.ja: 〝自由と正義は誰に？〞 自由である権利だけでなく 義務がある 自由である権利だけでなく 義務がある

translation.en: There were civil rights protests.
translation.ja: 公民権の抗議者がいた 公民権の抗議者がいた 〝一緒に戦おう〞

translation.en: There was this unpopular war.
translation.ja: 評判の悪い戦争だった

translation.en: We will prevail in Vietnam over the Communist aggressor!
translation.ja: 我々はベトナムで共産主義の 侵害に勝つ！

translation.en: The country split into what has come to be called hawks and doves.
translation.ja: アメリカはタカ派と ハト派に分断された

translation.en: Doves wanted to end the war.
translation.ja: ハト派は終戦を望み―

translation.en: Hawks wanted to pursue the war.
translation.ja: タカ派は続行を望んだ

translation.en: - What do you want? - Peace! - When do we get it? - Now!
translation.ja: 何を望む？平和！ いつ？今すぐに！

translation.en: And these two sides, both Americans,
translation.ja: ２派に別れたアメリカ人は― ２派に別れたアメリカ人は― 〝ハノイを潰せ〞 〝ハノイを潰せ〞

translation.en: both claiming to be patriots, went to war with each other.
translation.ja: 〝ハノイを潰せ〞 お互いに愛国者を名乗り 戦いを始めた お互いに愛国者を名乗り 戦いを始めた

translation.en: It was the perfect storm,
translation.ja: 最悪の事態だった

translation.en: and Nixon understood that.
translation.ja: ニクソンはわかってた

translation.en: And I pledge to you tonight that the first priority
translation.ja: 今夜ここで約束する １９６８年８月８日 共和党全国大会 次政権の外交政策における 最優先課題は―

translation.en: foreign policy objective of our next administration
translation.ja: １９６８年８月８日 共和党全国大会 次政権の外交政策における 最優先課題は―

translation.en: will be to bring an honorable end to the war in Vietnam.
translation.ja: ベトナム戦争に栄誉ある 終結をもたらすことである

translation.en: Nixon lost the 1960 presidential election to Kennedy,
translation.ja: ニクソンは1960年の大統領 選挙でケネディに負けた

translation.en: and he was traumatized by that defeat.
translation.ja: 落選は衝撃だった

translation.en: In 1968, he was running for president
translation.ja: 1968年大統領選挙に 立候補した

translation.en: in a desperate attempt to resurrect his career.
translation.ja: 復活への必死の試みだった

translation.en: The time has come for honest government in the United States of America!
translation.ja: 今アメリカ合衆国には公正な 政権が必要不可欠である！

translation.en: - Thank you! - Thank you, girls.
translation.ja: ありがとう ありがとう

translation.en: My father was never afraid to stand up for someone in need.
translation.ja: 父は困っている人に― いつも手を貸した

translation.en: And he would always put himself in a position to help those if he could.
translation.ja: 息子　音楽家 ジョン·キャッシュ いつでも助けようと努力した いつでも助けようと努力した

translation.en: It was that simplicity that was within the heart of the man.
translation.ja: その純粋な心こそが 彼そのものだった

translation.en: It wasn't the complications of politics.
translation.ja: 複雑な政治ではなく

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.ja: ありがとう

translation.en: I think that empathy goes back to the loss of his brother.
translation.ja: 父の優しさは亡くした 兄に由来する

translation.en: ♪ Beside a singin' mountain stream... ♪
translation.ja: 歌いながら流れる小川の横で

translation.en: Growing up, my father and his brother, Jack, were dearest of friends.
translation.ja: 父と彼の兄ジャックは 親友として育った

translation.en: Jack was a man of God at 14 years old.
translation.ja: ジャックは14歳で深く 神を信じていた

translation.en: He studied the Bible all the time.
translation.ja: いつも聖書を勉強し―

translation.en: He knew in his heart that he was going to be a pastor.
translation.ja: 牧師になると 心に決めていた

translation.en: They were so inseparable.
translation.ja: 本当に仲が良かった

translation.en: ♪ But flesh and blood Needs flesh and blood ♪
translation.ja: 血と肉は血と肉を求める

translation.en: ♪ And you are what I need ♪
translation.ja: 俺には君が必要だ

translation.en: On Saturdays, Johnny, Jack, and my other brothers,
translation.ja: 土曜日はジョニー ジャック その他の兄弟―

translation.en: all of us, would do odd jobs to help Mama with the groceries.
translation.ja: 皆で母の仕事を手伝った

translation.en: In May of 1944, Jack was sawing some fence post.
translation.ja: 1944年５月ジャックは 柵の支柱を鋸で切っていた

translation.en: As he was pushing the fence post into the saw,
translation.ja: 柵の支柱を鋸に押し当てた時

translation.en: it jerked... and jerked him into the saw.
translation.ja: 鋸が引っ掛かり彼が鋸に 突っ込んでしまった

translation.en: It was beyond horrible.
translation.ja: 惨状は言葉に表せない

translation.en: I remember Johnny crying and holding his hand,
translation.ja: ジョニーが彼の手を とって泣き崩れ―

translation.en: saying, Somebody do something!
translation.ja: 誰か助けて！と叫んだわ

translation.en: It was as bad as you can imagine.
translation.ja: 悲惨すぎる出来事だった

translation.en: The next day after the funeral,
translation.ja: お葬式の翌日 私たちは―

translation.en: we were all back in the cotton fields, working.
translation.ja: もう綿畑で働いていた

translation.en: I can't even describe the emptiness and the hurt.
translation.ja: その時の辛さは とても言葉にできない

translation.en: Ray and Carrie,
translation.ja: ジョニーの父 レイ 母 キャリー

translation.en: Johnny's mother and father, and 12- year- old Johnny
translation.ja: ジョニーの父 レイ 母 キャリー そして12歳のジョニーが―

translation.en: are the ones that had to shoulder that burden.
translation.ja: 増えた仕事を背負い込んだ

translation.en: It was back- breaking.
translation.ja: 重労働だった

translation.en: They were working every day and not getting anywhere.
translation.ja: 毎日働いたが ギリギリの 生活だった

translation.en: Ray Cash, who had thought Dyess was his promised land,
translation.ja: レイが約束の地だと思った ダイエスでの夢は―

translation.en: found that it wasn't.
translation.ja: 敗れた

translation.en: Jack was going to be a preacher.
translation.ja: ジャックは牧師になり

translation.en: He was going to be the son of Dyess that made it.
translation.ja: ダイエスでの成功者に なるはずだった

translation.en: Johnny was a very sensitive young man.
translation.ja: ジョニーは繊細な青年だった

translation.en: There was not room for sensitivity.
translation.ja: でも生活にそんな 余裕はなかった

translation.en: There was not room for dreamers in Dyess, Arkansas in the 1940s.
translation.ja: 1940年代のダイエスで夢を 見ることは許されなかった

translation.en: Ray became so bitter, he resented his son.
translation.ja: レイは周りに冷酷になり 息子をさげすむようになった

translation.en: He would look at Johnny and he would say, You weren't the right son.
translation.ja: ジョニーを見ては言った 死ぬべきだった息子は―

translation.en: You should've died.
translation.ja: お前だった

translation.en: Johnny Cash grew up feeling unworthy of being himself.
translation.ja: ジョニーは自分を 無価値な者と信じて育った

translation.en: He felt that he would never measure up to what his father wanted him to be.
translation.ja: 父親が望むような大人には 決してなれないと思い育った

translation.en: Something happened within my dad,
translation.ja: 父に何か変化があった

translation.en: and there was this deep wound that was placed there,
translation.ja: 深い傷を負ってしまった

translation.en: this hollow well.
translation.ja: 乾いた井戸のように

translation.en: There was also a drive that was installed,
translation.ja: 同時に意欲も沸き―

translation.en: and all these different faces that were Johnny Cash were developed
translation.ja: 彼の様々な表情が創られた

translation.en: through that great loss at an early age.
translation.ja: この幼い時の辛い経験から

translation.en: A prison's a prison.
translation.ja: 刑務所は刑務所だ

translation.en: And that's all it is.
translation.ja: それだけ

translation.en: I'm sure you'll enjoy him this afternoon.
translation.ja: 今日はお楽しみください

translation.en: He seems to have a lot of things in common with you, Mr. Johnny Cash!
translation.ja: 共通点が沢山あるようです ジョニー·キャッシュ！

translation.en: My father knew what it was like to suffer. He knew what it was like to feel lost.
translation.ja: 父は苦難とは何か喪失感とは 何か知っていた

translation.en: And so, he could connect with other people's suffering.
translation.ja: なので他人の苦しみに 共感できた

translation.en: He sang for those who needed something to believe in and needed to be lifted up.
translation.ja: 何かを信じたい者 励ましが 必要な者のために歌った

translation.en: In January of 1968,
Johnny Cash went to Folsom Prison and performed for the inmates.
translation.ja: 彼はフォルサム刑務所へ行き 受刑者の前で歌った

translation.en: ♪ I hear the train a comin' It's rollin' 'round the bend ♪
translation.ja: 電車の音がする 　　カーブを曲がってくる

translation.en: ♪ And I ain't seen the sunshine Since I don't know when ♪
translation.ja: もうずっと 　　陽の光を見ていない

translation.en: ♪ I'm stuck in Folsom Prison And time keeps draggin' on ♪
translation.ja: フォルサム刑務所に入った 　　まま時間ばかりが過ぎる

translation.en: - - Yeah!
translation.ja: イェーイ！

translation.en: He looked on some of those guys in there,
translation.ja: 受刑者の顔や彼らの―

translation.en: looked on the desperation in their eyes,
translation.ja: 目に宿った絶望を見て―

translation.en: and he thought, There but for the grace of God goes me.
translation.ja: 神のご加護がなかったら―

translation.en: I made some stumbles in my life. That could've been me.
translation.ja: 刑務所に入ってた かもしれないと思った

translation.en: ♪ But I shot a man in Reno Just to watch him die... ♪
translation.ja: 死ぬところを見るために 　　リノで人を撃った

translation.en: He brought recording equipment because he wanted people to hear
translation.ja: 彼は録音機器を持参した 受刑者を前にした演奏を他の 人々に聞いてもらいたかった

translation.en: the rawness of what it was like to perform for these men.
translation.ja: 受刑者を前にした演奏を他の 人々に聞いてもらいたかった

translation.en: John always related to prisoners,
translation.ja: ジョンはいつも受刑者や―

translation.ja: 特別な文化的瞬間のために

translation.ja: 特にテネシー州の上院選挙 に向けて

translation.en: the new Republican party is being born in the South.
translation.ja: 白（独立党） 新しい共和党が生まれた 白（独立党）

translation.ja: テネシー州上院議員 アル·ジョージ二世 ニクソン大統領は ホワイトハウスにおいて ニクソン大統領は ホワイトハウスにおいて

translation.ja: 南部戦略の手段として―

translation.ja: 素晴らしいものでした

translation.en: - Hello there! - Hello.

translation.en: he was the champion for such rights as Native American rights.
translation.ja: 父はアメリカ先住民の権利に とても敏感だった

translation.en: This down here is where they were?

translation.ja: ここで皆殺されました

translation.en: across the creek over there.
translation.ja: １９６８年 インディアン保留地 １９６８年 インディアン保留地 川の向こう岸でも

translation.en: The American government, with Gatling guns, machine guns,
translation.ja: アメリカ政府は銃で 罪のない女性や子供を殺した アメリカ政府は銃で 罪のない女性や子供を殺した 音楽家 友人 ビル·ミラー

translation.en: killed innocent women and children
translation.ja: アメリカ政府は銃で 罪のない女性や子供を殺した 音楽家 友人 ビル·ミラー 音楽家 友人 ビル·ミラー

translation.ja: 音楽家 友人 ビル·ミラー 1890年12月29日のことだった 1890年12月29日のことだった

translation.ja: まだ政府との土地の―

translation.en: People were seeing us as outsiders,

translation.en: didn't accept people who've been downtrodden.

translation.en: The beauty of Johnny Cash was he'd bring it into the songs.

translation.en: Bitter Tears was a serious record about United States indigenous people,

translation.en: and there was nothing like it in the world.

translation.en: He had songs like The Ballad of Ira Hayes.

translation.ja: 彼はピマ部族出身で若くして 海軍に入隊した

translation.en: He was one of the men who actually hoisted the flag

translation.en: upon victory in Iwo Jima.

translation.en: Ira Hayes died a sad, lonely death

translation.en: at the hands of alcoholism and depression.
translation.ja: アル中とうつ病を患っていた

translation.en: Johnny Cash, this atypical son of the South,
translation.ja: 南部出身のキャッシュが歌う

translation.en: is singing about social causes
translation.ja: 社会問題に関する 曲を聴くのは

translation.en: The Bitter Tears album was boycotted by the music industry
translation.ja: 「ビター·ティアーズ」を 業界は拒否した

translation.en: and John became enraged by that.
translation.ja: ジョニー·キャッシュは 激怒した

translation.en: This offense brought out the rebel inside him.

translation.ja: 彼は音楽業界に手紙を書き

translation.en: Why don't you play 'Ira Hayes'?

translation.ja: 〝卑劣な行為〞 この曲には目的があり この曲には目的があり

translation.en: This song is important.

translation.en: Johnny Cash was giving a voice to us who weren't being heard.

translation.en: He said, Well, I'm no better than anybody else.
translation.ja: 息子は僕だって皆と同じ

translation.en: He grew up on a little farm just a couple of miles out of town.
translation.ja: 彼は街のはずれの 　　小さな農場で育った

translation.en: Her son was in Vietnam
translation.ja: 彼はベトナムで―

translation.en: and was killed.

translation.en: Johnny Cash was deeply upset.
translation.ja: キャッシュは激しく動揺し

translation.en: It was a very...

translation.ja: 遺体はまず飛行機に 次は電車に

translation.en: Like so many in this country

translation.en: ♪ ...thought that he was President or something ♪

translation.en: ♪ At Route #1, Box 144 ♪
translation.ja: ルート１ ボックス144にて

translation.ja: 父は常に兵士を支持した

translation.en: Of course, my father himself served in the Air Force
translation.ja: 父自身も空軍にいました

translation.en: during the Korean conflict.
translation.ja: 朝鮮戦争の時でした

translation.en: He would set aside any political notion
translation.ja: 父は政治概念や―

translation.en: or any consideration of whether one certain battle was right or wrong,

translation.en: and support the men and young women that were fighting and giving their lives for us.
translation.ja: 国民のために命をかけて戦う 若者たちを常に支持した

translation.ja: ある朝 俺は妻にこう言った

translation.en: ♪ We've been everywhere once And some places twice ♪

translation.en: ♪ As I had another helping Of country ham ♪

translation.en: ♪ She said we've never been to Vietnam ♪
translation.ja: ベトナムはまだねと

translation.en: ♪ There's a quarter of a million Of our boys over there... ♪
translation.ja: 25万人の米兵が行ってる 25万人の米兵が行ってる １９６９年 ロンビン空軍基地

translation.en: He went to Vietnam in December of 1969,
translation.ja: １９６９年 ロンビン空軍基地 1969年12月 彼はベトナムへ 1969年12月 彼はベトナムへ

translation.en: just months before the White House concert.
translation.ja: ホワイトハウスに行く 数ヵ月前だった

translation.en: And he and June laid there in the tent

translation.en: listening to the shells exploding, listening to the sounds of war,
translation.ja: 爆撃がさく裂する音 戦争の音―

translation.en: of people dying, of watching the carnage.
translation.ja: 人が死んでいく音 虐殺の音を聞いた

translation.en: It made a very serious impression on him.
translation.ja: 生涯忘れられない 経験になった

translation.en: ♪ Then we did our last song For the night ♪
translation.ja: その夜最後の曲を歌い

translation.en: ♪ And we crawled into bed For some peace and quiet ♪ ♪ But things weren't peaceful ♪
translation.ja: 安らぎを求め横になった 　だが無理な話だった

translation.en: ♪ Things weren't quiet ♪
translation.ja: 静寂もない

translation.en: I'd gone over with my father to Vietnam.
translation.ja: 私は父と一緒にベトナムに 行きました

translation.en: I was at the airport, the Tan Son Nhat airport,
translation.ja: ジミー·スノウ牧師 タンソンニュート空港で 帰りの便を待っていると―

translation.en: getting ready to fly back,
translation.ja: ジミー·スノウ牧師 タンソンニュート空港で 帰りの便を待っていると― タンソンニュート空港で 帰りの便を待っていると―

translation.en: and I said, That looks like John and June Cash!
translation.ja: ジョンとジューンらしき 人影が

translation.en: And so I made my way over,
translation.ja: 二人の所へ歩いて行き

translation.ja: ベトナムで何してるんだ？ と聞いた

translation.en: He said, I'm in a search mode right now.
translation.ja: 彼は考え事があって と言った

translation.en: He said, I'm troubled about what's happening here.
translation.ja: ここで起きてることに 問題を感じてるとも

translation.en: He said, You know, Jimmie, I was raised in a Baptist church in Arkansas.
translation.ja: 彼は言った　アーカンソーで 教会に通って育ったから

translation.en: I know what's right.
translation.ja: 善悪はわかる

translation.en: He said, What troubled me was it had taken our soldiers down.
translation.ja: 何が問題かって兵士の 気持ちが落ち込んでる

translation.en: It had pulled their... their morale, their spirit down
translation.ja: 祖国の現状を知り士気も 気力も下がってしまった

translation.en: because of what they heard back home.
translation.ja: 祖国の現状を知り士気も 気力も下がってしまった 〝人間でなく 貧困を消せ！〞 〝人間でなく 貧困を消せ！〞

translation.en: Because of the way our country was so divided.
translation.ja: 〝バークレーを 爆撃せよ〞 国も２つに分断された

translation.en: Some of them had reached a point where...
translation.ja: 兵士の中には自分の立場に―

translation.en: What're we doing this for? Why are we over here?
translation.ja: 疑問を持つ者も出てきた 疑問を持つ者も出てきた 〝平和を今！〞

translation.en: Because politics had entered so strongly into Vietnam.
translation.ja: 政治がベトナムに 深入りし過ぎていた

translation.en: They were... looking for
translation.ja: 彼らは― ほんの少しでも

translation.en: a little bit of hope.
translation.ja: 希望を欲した

translation.en: We prayed about that.
translation.ja: 祈りました

translation.en: Servicemen and prisoners have a lot in common.
translation.ja: 兵士と受刑者には 共通点がある

translation.en: There is a kind of a brotherhood about the whole situation.
translation.ja: 兄弟愛のようなものが 芽生える

translation.en: I think they feel a lot of the same things.
translation.ja: 似た感情を持っている

translation.en: The loneliness, and a lot of times, boredom,
translation.ja: 孤独や退屈

translation.en: and isolation.
translation.ja: そして孤立感

translation.en: And he said there are some things that I want to do
translation.ja: 彼は やりたい事がある―

translation.en: that I feel like I need to do now with my voice.
translation.ja: 今 声で表現すべき事がある と言いました

translation.en: We oughta live every day just as though the Lord's coming!
translation.ja: 神が帰ると信じ生きる！

translation.en: Doing all we can...
translation.ja: 人を助ける

translation.en: to help our neighbor!
translation.ja: 努力をする！

translation.en: And above all, loving!
translation.ja: 何より 愛だ！

translation.ja: 他にキャッシュに 注目したのは

translation.ja: スター説教師 ビリー・ グラハムだった

translation.en: President Nixon and Dr. Graham had been friends for decades.
translation.ja: ニクソン大統領とグラハム 牧師は長年の友人だった

translation.en: Billy Graham called John and said, May I meet Mr. Cash?

translation.en: My son is a rebellious teenager.
translation.ja: 彼の息子は反抗期なので―

translation.en: I want to ask John advice.
translation.ja: 助言を受けたいと

translation.en: One Sunday in December 1969,
translation.ja: 1969年12月のある日曜日―

translation.en: Billy and Ruth Graham came to supper at the Cash's.
translation.ja: グラハム夫妻はキャッシュ家 に夕食に招待された

translation.en: Billy Graham says to him,
translation.ja: グラハムは言った

translation.en: Johnny, you are somebody who speaks to youth
translation.ja: 君は若者に語りかける 力を持っている

translation.en: because you are so authentic and that's what they are looking for today.
translation.ja: 君が本物で今の若者は それを求めている

translation.en: And I hope that you will use this gift
translation.ja: その才能を上手く使って―

translation.en: to further good purpose
translation.ja: 現代の若者に―

translation.en: in speaking to young people today.
translation.ja: 語りかけて欲しい

translation.en: This is the Arkansas sharecropper's son,
translation.ja: 片田舎の貧しい農家の息子が

translation.en: sitting there listening to this.
translation.ja: ここまで来るなんて

translation.en: June is five months pregnant at the time. This is their first child together.
translation.ja: 当時ジューンは妊娠中で ２人の最初の子だった

translation.en: He hasn't necessarily been the best father
translation.ja: 父親の鏡ではなかった

translation.en: to his four girls that he left with Vivian in California.
translation.ja: カリフォルニアに残した 娘４人には

translation.en: He is thinking about his responsibility to the future now.
translation.ja: 当時彼は将来の責任について 考えていた

translation.en: And when Billy Graham left, John said to his father, Well, Daddy,
translation.ja: ビリー·グラハムが帰ると 彼は父に言った

translation.en: Billy Graham just had supper in my house.
translation.ja: 今グラハム氏が家で夕食 をとった

translation.en: That was pretty good, wasn't it?
translation.ja: すごいと思わない？

translation.en: And Ray said, You ain't shit, boy. That's nothing.
translation.ja: すると彼の父は言った どうでもいいことだ！

translation.en: It was devastating.
translation.ja: 衝撃だった

translation.en: Throughout his life, my father saw a lot of struggle, a lot of troubles.
translation.ja: 父の人生は苦難に満ちていた

translation.en: When I was born and I was healthy,
translation.ja: 私が健康に生まれた時

translation.en: he was lifted up inside.
translation.ja: 父の心に火が灯った

translation.en: He was just ecstatic.
translation.ja: 彼は非常に喜んだ

translation.en: He thought that that was a great blessing.
translation.ja: 素晴らしい祝福だと思った

translation.en: Here's the chance to be the father that he never had to his own son.

translation.en: - He's doing all right, ain't he, Mama? - He's doing fine.
translation.ja: 息子は元気かい？ 元気よ

translation.en: John was so moved and inspired after meeting Billy Graham
translation.ja: ビリー·グラハムに 出会い 息子が生まれ

translation.en: and becoming a father, that he wrote a new song
translation.ja: 彼の中で変化が起きた 若者と未来について新しい 曲をかいた

translation.en: about young people and the future.
translation.ja: 若者と未来について新しい 曲をかいた

translation.en: Uh, Houston, we've had a problem.
translation.ja: 問題が発生した

translation.en: As it happened, the same week as the White House concert,
translation.ja: ホワイトハウスでの演奏と 同じ週に―

translation.en: the Apollo 13 astronauts were stranded in space.
translation.ja: 宇宙飛行中のアポロ13に 問題が起きた

translation.en: But they came down to Earth safely.
translation.ja: しかし無事地球に帰還した

translation.en: Just a beautiful sight to see!

translation.en: And welcome home!

translation.en: Theirs is the spirit that built America.
translation.ja: この国を創る尊い精神だ

translation.ja: アポロ13が帰還した日の午後 ホワイトハウスに到着した

translation.en: We were excited to go.
translation.ja: 楽しみにしていた 音楽仲間 ドン·レイド 音楽仲間 ドン·レイド

translation.en: Although, you know, there was a lot of turmoil with the war going on,
translation.ja: 音楽仲間 ドン·レイド 戦争関連の問題が あったのは知ってた 戦争関連の問題が あったのは知ってた

translation.en: and marching in the streets and violence
translation.ja: 街頭マーチや暴動―

translation.en: and a lot of hatred on both sides.

translation.en: But we said, No, this is the White House. This is history.
translation.ja: でも歴史に残ることだって

translation.en: John invited his family.

translation.en: We're very happy to welcome all of you tonight

translation.en: at this evening at the White House.
translation.ja: １９７０年４月17日 ようこそホワイトハウスに いらっしゃいました ようこそホワイトハウスに いらっしゃいました

translation.en: It's rather hard to describe Johnny Cash in terms that are perhaps adequate.

translation.en: The music that he represents tonight

translation.en: is called country music and western music,
translation.ja: カントリーと呼ばれるが―

translation.en: but I think it's really American music,

translation.en: because it speaks in stories about America,

translation.en: in a way that touches the hearts of all Americans, north, east, west, and south.
translation.ja: 全ての国民の心に響くだろう

translation.en: Ladies and gentlemen, Johnny Cash.

translation.en: I was a little bit uptight because you never know exactly what's going to work.
translation.ja: 少し緊張してた 何が起きるかわからなかった

translation.en: This is a different audience.

translation.en: And when you put a tuxedo and gowns on people, they become different people.

translation.en: They're not as loose and as jovial as they usually are.

translation.en: and you think, Wow, let's hope this comes off.

translation.en: We hope to show you a little bit of the soul of the South tonight.

translation.en: ♪ Well, they gave him his orders At Monroe, Virginia... ♪

translation.en: I never had any idea what we were gonna play.
translation.ja: 何を演奏するのか全く 知らなかった

translation.en: It didn't do any good to rehearse with Johnny Cash

translation.en: because he didn't know what he was going do.
translation.ja: ドラマー Ｗ·Ｓ·ホランド 彼自身 何を演奏するか 決めてなかった 彼自身 何を演奏するか 決めてなかった

translation.en: ♪ ...poor boy ♪
translation.ja: 貧しい男の子

translation.en: Daddy. Daddy, you remember this.
translation.ja: 父さん これ覚えてるかな

translation.en: ♪ How high is the water, Papa? ♪
translation.ja: 水位は上がってる？

translation.en: ♪ He said It's two feet high and rising... ♪

translation.ja: 父が何を歌うのか大統領を 含め誰も知らなかった

translation.en: ♪ High and rising... ♪

translation.en: I get asked a lot of questions about war and...

translation.en: drugs and youth and...
translation.ja: 薬物 若者について

translation.en: this and that. Well...
translation.ja: 他にも色々と

translation.ja: 我々はサイゴンに近い 空軍基地で演奏した

translation.en: We did shows for the men over there,
translation.ja: 兵士たちのために

translation.en: as many as we could for the time that we had.
translation.ja: 時間が許す限り歌った

translation.en: Somebody said, That makes you a hawk. You went to Vietnam.
translation.ja: タカ派のやることだと 言われた

translation.en: No, but after you watch the wounded come in in the helicopters,

translation.en: if you were a dove, you might come away a dove with claws.

translation.en: All of a sudden, John got very quiet.
translation.ja: 突然ジョンは沈黙した

translation.en: We were in trouble...

translation.en: We're waiting with these solemn looks on our faces. What's going on?
translation.ja: 私たちは不安な表情で 待ちました

translation.en: Of course, um,
translation.ja: もちろん

translation.en: in order to say something to somebody that might be meaningful, you...
translation.ja: 何か重要なことを誰かに 伝えたい時

translation.en: gotta kind of get them on your side.
translation.ja: まずは味方にすることだ

translation.en: So I had these words, a poem that I wrote to the youth of America.

translation.en: ♪ What is truth? ♪

translation.en: ♪ Little boy of three Sitting on the floor ♪
translation.ja: 床に座る３歳の男の子が

translation.en: ♪ Son, that's when people Fight and die ♪
translation.ja: 人々が戦って死ぬことだ

translation.en: ♪ Little boy of three says Daddy, why? ♪

translation.ja: 日曜学校で17歳の青年が

translation.en: ♪ It may be his turn To lay his life down ♪

translation.en: ♪ Can you blame the voice of youth For asking ♪

translation.en: ♪ What is truth? ♪

translation.en: I saw the squirming in Nixon's chair when Johnny was singing What is Truth.
translation.ja: ジョニーがこの歌を歌った時  大統領は気まずそうでした

translation.en: Nixon was smart enough and attentive enough to be uncomfortable.
translation.ja: 大統領は意図を理解し 気まずかったと思う 大統領は意図を理解し 気まずかったと思う 元大統領補佐官

translation.ja: 若者が証人席に立ち―

translation.en: ♪ Man with a book says ♪
translation.ja: 聖書を持った男が言う 　　手を挙げ私に続いて

translation.en: ♪ Raise your hand, repeat after me I solemnly swear ♪
translation.ja: 聖書を持った男が言う 　　手を挙げ私に続いて 厳粛に誓う―

translation.en: ♪ Judge looked down at his long hair ♪
translation.ja: 判事は彼の長い髪を見下ろし

translation.en: ♪ And although the young man Solemnly swore ♪

translation.en: ♪ Nobody seemed to hear anymore ♪

translation.en: ♪ And it didn't really matter If the truth was there ♪

translation.en: ♪ It was the cut of his clothes And the length of his hair ♪
translation.ja: 服装と長髪で判断された

translation.en: ♪ And the lonely voice of youth cries ♪
translation.ja: 孤独な若者が叫ぶ

translation.en: ♪ What is truth? ♪
translation.ja: 真実って何？

translation.en: ♪ Young girl dancing to the latest beat ♪
translation.ja: 若い女性が踊ってる

translation.en: ♪ Found new ways to move her feet ♪
translation.ja: 新しいステップを覚えた

translation.en: ♪ Young man speaking in the city square ♪
translation.ja: 若者が街の広場で話してる

translation.en: ♪ Trying to tell somebody that he cares ♪
translation.ja: 他人への思いやりについて

translation.en: ♪ Yeah, the ones That you're callin' wild ♪

translation.en: ♪ Gonna be the leaders In a little while ♪
translation.ja: 将来の指導者たちだ

translation.en: ♪ This old world's waking To a newborn day ♪
translation.ja: 世界は新しく 　　生まれ変わり―

translation.en: ♪ And I solemnly swear That it'll be their way ♪
translation.ja: 彼らの世界になると 　　私は厳粛に誓う

translation.en: ♪ We better help that Voice of youth find ♪
translation.ja: 若者たちに聞かれたら 　　答えられるだろうか

translation.en: ♪ What is truth? ♪
translation.ja: 真実って何？

translation.en: ♪ And the lonely voice of youth cries What is truth? ♪
translation.ja: 孤独な若者が叫ぶ 　　真実って何？

translation.en: Johnny had a way to say something in a song to get a point across,
translation.ja: ジョニーは歌で気持ちを 伝える方法を知ってた

translation.en: and he did it well.
translation.ja: とても上手だった

translation.en: The most powerful man in the United States at that time,
translation.ja: 当時米国で最も権力の あった彼でさえ

translation.en: I think it got to him.
translation.ja: 影響された

translation.en: He understood the message.
translation.ja: メッセージを理解したと思う

translation.en: My father wasn't afraid to say what he thought,
translation.ja: 父は躊躇せず思いを 言葉にした

translation.en: which was, I hope to bring peace. But I'm not afraid to get dirty.
translation.ja: 平和を実現したい そのためなら何でもする

translation.en: And I'm not afraid to fight for what I believe in.
translation.ja: 信念のために戦う

translation.en: And I'm not afraid to go where I'm uncomfortable
translation.ja: 不愉快に思われてもいい

translation.en: to stand up for love.
translation.ja: 愛のためなら

translation.en: I'm a dove with claws.
translation.ja: 俺は戦うハトだ

translation.en: Johnny Cash was putting himself front- and- center.
translation.ja: 全観客の注目が彼に 集まっていた

translation.en: He had gone out on a limb there.
translation.ja: 危険な橋を渡ったと思う

translation.en: This song was delivering a message that the current leaders who were looking on young people
translation.ja: この曲を通して彼は若者を 過小評価する指導者に―

translation.en: and marginalizing them need to understand that
translation.ja: 若者こそが国の将来で―

translation.en: this is the future, and we need to honor and respect that.
translation.ja: 彼らを尊重する義務があると 伝えたかったんだと思う

translation.en: Mr. Nixon, whose personal taste in music runs more to tunes from South Pacific,
translation.ja: ミュージカルの音楽を 好む大統領ですが―

translation.en: threw himself into the foot- tapping spirit of Cash's twanging guitar,
translation.ja: 今晩は素朴なギターの 音色に耳を傾けた

translation.en: and when it was over, heaped praise on the entire troupe.
translation.ja: 最後は盛大な拍手で感謝した

translation.en: The closest Cash came to a song with obvious political overtones
translation.ja: キャッシュが最も政治色を 出した曲は―

translation.en: has a theme not from the '30s, but from now,
translation.ja: 30年代の曲でなく 現代の曲だった

translation.en: and the thrust of it seemed to surprise the president a bit.
translation.ja: 内容に関し大統領は 少し驚いていた

translation.en: Johnny Cash, you've played country fairs, Grand Ole Oprys and before prison audiences.
translation.ja: 今までの演奏はコンサート 会場やカントリーフェア

translation.en: Was it any different tonight,
translation.ja: または刑務所でした

translation.en: playing before the President of the United States and at the White House?
translation.ja: 今晩の演奏は他と 違いましたか？

translation.en: Well, in several ways, it was, Dan.
translation.ja: 色々な意味で―

translation.en: It was quite different, uh...
translation.ja: 全く違いました

translation.en: We were playing for some very important people tonight, of course.
translation.ja: 今晩は偉い方々が 多くいらしてた

translation.en: I tried to keep the performance honest.
translation.ja: 実直な演奏にしたかった

translation.en: Good or bad,
translation.ja: 良くも悪くも

translation.en: it was honest, I think.
translation.ja: 達成できた

translation.en: My dad would never, in his life, disrespect the office of the presidency.
translation.ja: 父は決して大統領をバカに するような人ではなかった

translation.en: It was part of his patriotism.
translation.ja: 愛国者として

translation.en: He had a history of being bold.
translation.ja: 常に勇敢な人だった

translation.en: But his performance at the White House was a turning point.
translation.ja: あの夜の演奏は 分岐点だった

translation.en: Evidently, John knew something or picked up on something
translation.ja: 明らかにジョンは 何か知っていた

translation.en: and I think he was trying to say, powerfully, to President Nixon,
translation.ja: 大統領に何かを伝えようと していたんだと思う

translation.en: You need to think about what you're doing. And you need to be truthful.
translation.ja: 胸に手を当てて 何をしてるか考えろ

translation.en: Who would have ever thought that that song would have been so prophetic?
translation.ja: あの曲が予言的だったことに 皆驚いた

translation.en: I have concluded that the time has come for action.
translation.ja: １９７０年４月30日 行動を起こす時が来た 行動を起こす時が来た

translation.en: Attacks are being launched this week to clean out major enemy sanctuaries
translation.ja: 今週 敵の聖域への 爆撃を開始する

translation.en: on the Cambodian/Vietnam border.
translation.ja: ベトナムとカンボジアの 国境だ

translation.en: Shortly after the Johnny Cash event,
translation.ja: コンサートの後

translation.en: Nixon announced the Cambodian Incursion.
translation.ja: ニクソンはカンボジア侵略を 発表した ニクソンはカンボジア侵略を 発表した 〝カンボジア〞

translation.en: The speech basically said that Americans are going to be fighting in Cambodia.
translation.ja: 米兵がカンボジアで戦う との発表だった

translation.en: Cambodia was a neutral country.
translation.ja: 中立国だったのに―

translation.en: Nixon had been bombing it secretly, without Congressional approval,
translation.ja: 議会の承認なしで密かに 爆撃が開始されていた

translation.en: and without the knowledge of the American people.
translation.ja: 国民も知らなかった

translation.en: It galvanized those who said, Well, wait a minute.
translation.ja: 〝ニクソンの 殺りく阻止〞 ベトナムから撤退する と信じていた―

translation.en: We're supposed to be getting out of Vietnam.
translation.ja: 人々は衝撃を受けた 人々は衝撃を受けた 〝全兵士の帰国を〞

translation.en: Now, we're expanding the war.
translation.ja: 戦争を拡大するなんて 〝帝国主義反対〞

translation.en: We all thought he was doing one thing,
translation.ja: 予想してたことと

translation.en: and they were actually doing another.
translation.ja: 正反対のことだった

translation.en: Nixon lied not only to America
translation.ja: ニクソンは国民だけでなく

translation.en: but to our soldiers.
translation.ja: 兵士にも嘘をついた 〝退役軍人として 戦争反対〞 〝退役軍人として 戦争反対〞

translation.en: The country went into flames.
translation.ja: 国中が炎上した

translation.en: At Kent State University, there had been riots.
translation.ja: １９７０年５月４日 ケント州立大学 １９７０年５月４日 ケント州立大学 ケント州立大学で 暴動が起きた

translation.en: National Guard troops were on the campuses.
translation.ja: キャンパスに州兵が来た

translation.en: Instantly, there were four dead and nine wounded.
translation.ja: 即 死者４名 傷者９名が出た

translation.en: Kent State happened two weeks after the White House performance.
translation.ja: ホワイトハウスでの演奏の ２週間後にこの惨事が起きた

translation.en: For all of his support for the president and for the government,
translation.ja: あれほど大統領も政権も 支持したのに―

translation.en: Johnny Cash was blindsided.
translation.ja: ジョニーには不意打ちだった

translation.en: John didn't like the idea of being used.
translation.ja: ジョンは使われるのが 嫌いだった

translation.en: Those young people out there seem to be
translation.ja: 若者たちは

translation.en: trying to hold on to that part of our American heritage
translation.ja: 美しいアメリカの伝統を

translation.en: that they believe was good and beautiful.
translation.ja: 失うまいと努力してる

translation.en: All they desire is to be listened to.
translation.ja: 声を聞いて欲しいだけ

translation.en: They're only exercising their freedom of speech
translation.ja: 言論の自由を行使してるだけ

translation.en: and God help you if that's ever taken away from them, America.
translation.ja: その権利は誰にも奪えない

translation.en: John starts thinking much harder about the totality of what's going on.
translation.ja: ジョンは状況の全体像を より真剣に考え始めた

translation.en: He sang Blowin' in the Wind on his television show.
translation.ja: 彼の番組で“風に吹かれて” を歌った

translation.en: ♪ How many times Must the cannonballs fly ♪
translation.ja: いくつの砲弾が飛び交えば いくつの砲弾が飛び交えば １９７０年 退役軍人の日

translation.en: ♪ Before they're forever banned? ♪
translation.ja: 永遠に禁止されるのだろう

translation.en: Blowin' in the Wind was a whistle.
translation.ja: この曲は警笛だった

translation.en: The quintessential anti- war anthem.
translation.ja: 正に反戦歌だった

translation.en: ♪ The answer is blowin' in the wind ♪
translation.ja: 答えは風に吹かれている

translation.en: The people in the audience,
translation.ja: 観客の半数は

translation.en: half of them sat on their hands.
translation.ja: じっと座って動かず―

translation.en: The other half burst into a standing ovation.
translation.ja: もう半数は起立して 拍手喝采した

translation.en: That was America.
translation.ja: アメリカだよ

translation.en: Johnny Cash was America.
translation.ja: 彼がアメリカだった

translation.en: Five men arrested early Saturday,
translation.ja: 男５人がウォーターゲートの 男５人がウォーターゲートの １９７２年６月17日 首都

translation.en: who were charged with breaking into the party's national headquarters
translation.ja: １９７２年６月17日 首都 １９７２年６月17日 首都 参謀本部に不法侵入した疑い で土曜日に逮捕された 参謀本部に不法侵入した疑い で土曜日に逮捕された

translation.en: at the Watergate in Washington.
translation.ja: 参謀本部に不法侵入した疑い で土曜日に逮捕された

translation.en: Mr. Butterfield, are you aware of the installation of any listening devices in the Oval Office of the President?
translation.ja: 大統領執務室内の盗聴器の 設置を知っていましたか

translation.en: I was aware of listening devices. Yes, sir.
translation.ja: はい 知っていました

translation.en: I'm from a military family. Lying was just considered-- We just didn't do it.
translation.ja: 私が育った軍人の家庭では 嘘は許されなかった

translation.en: In August 1974, the president resigned
translation.ja: 1974年８月大統領は弾劾の―

translation.en: in the face of almost certain impeachment.
translation.ja: 可能性に直面し辞任した

translation.en: John attended the trial of HR Haldeman
translation.ja: 彼はある裁判を傍聴した

translation.en: amid the trials associated with the Watergate break- ins.
translation.ja: ウォーターゲート事件の 捜査の最中だった

translation.en: You guys have to get up awfully early, don't you?
translation.ja: ずいぶん早起きしたね

translation.en: Watergate was personal to him because of what it represented,
translation.ja: この事件はジョンにとって 重要だった

translation.en: of what Johnny Cash was always seeing as the nobility of the American people.
translation.ja: 国民にとって高潔であるべき 人々に関わる事件だったから

translation.en: And when our leaders let us down,
translation.ja: 指導者に裏切られて―

translation.en: he felt it very personally.
translation.ja: 個人的に憤慨した

translation.en: So, here is Johnny Cash watching HR Haldeman on trial,
translation.ja: キャッシュはハルデマン氏の 裁判を傍聴した

translation.en: who had been at the White House four years before
translation.ja: ４年前のホワイトハウスでの 演奏に―

translation.en: for Johnny's White House performance.
translation.ja: 招待されていた人だった

translation.en: Haldeman turned to John and said,
translation.ja: ハルデマンはジョンに言った

translation.en: I'm sorry. I let you down.
translation.ja: 裏切ることになって 申し訳ない

translation.en: If Johnny were here today,
translation.ja: まだ彼が生きていたら

translation.en: and he is in spirit,
translation.ja: 魂はここにいるわ

translation.en: he'd play that song.
translation.ja: あの曲を歌うはず

translation.en: I'm going to go request it to be played
translation.ja: 私がリクエストするわ

translation.en: on the airwaves,
translation.ja: 放送してって

translation.en: because that message in that song, What is Truth,
translation.ja: “真実って何？”で彼が 伝えるメッセージを―

translation.en: needs to be heard today.
translation.ja: 今皆に聞いて欲しい

translation.en: It was not long after his performance at the White House
translation.ja: ホワイトハウスの演奏の後 すぐに

translation.en: that Dad released the song Man in Black.
translation.ja: “メン·イン·ブラック” が出た

translation.en: And if you want to understand what my dad stood for,
translation.ja: 父が何と戦っていたか―

translation.en: the words to the song Man in Black exemplify that.
translation.ja: 歌詞を聴くと よくわかると思う

translation.en: ♪ I wear the black for the poor And the beaten- down ♪
translation.ja: 貧しい人々のために 　　黒を着る

translation.en: ♪ Livin' in the hopeless Hungry side of town ♪
translation.ja: 希望も食べ物もない 　　地域に住んでる

translation.en: ♪ And I wear it for the prisoner ♪
translation.ja: 受刑者のために黒を着る

translation.en: ♪ Who has long paid for his crime ♪
translation.ja: 罪は償い終わってるのに

translation.en: ♪ But still is there because He's the victim of the times ♪
translation.ja: 時世の犠牲者として 　　まだそこにいる

translation.en: ♪ I'm the man in black ♪
translation.ja: 黒服の男は俺だ
